subject: unfathomable classpath troubles
msgSnippet: Hi, I m getting some pretty bizarre errors with JUnit that I think are classpath related. When I run my app normally (outside of JUnit) it works fine. But when
messageBody:
Hi,

I'm getting some pretty bizarre errors with JUnit that I think are
classpath related. When I run my app normally (outside of JUnit) it
works fine. But when I run tests with the JUnit textUI -- using the
exact same classpath (which includes junit.jar) -- it fails with an
exception: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
com/sun/activation/registries/LogSupport.

It's true that the class is not in the classpath, but why does it
suddenly need it under JUnit when the exact same scenario works fine
outside of JUnit? The 2 tests in my TestCase do, in fact, run but it
appears to gets an exception when reporting the results. The last
step in the test scenario is to send an email. This does not occur
because of the exception.

Furthermore, when I run it using the JUnit GUI using the exact same
classpath I get a different set of errors! The tests do not appear
to run under the GUI.

Any insight will be greatly appreciated. I can provide source,
scripts, jars etc.

Here is the OUTPUT (2 tests are run; the exception appears to occur
afterwards -- how??). The first part are log entries created by the
app:
.05:16:53,416 INFO [DnsMonitor] New IP: 68.164.215.212
05:16:55,459 INFO [DnsUpdater] Http-RC=200

.05:16:55,655 INFO [DnsMonitor] New IP: 68.164.215.212

scheme selected

BASIC 'DynDNS Members NIC'@...:443
05:16:56,004 INFO [DnsUpdater] Http-RC=401
05:16:56,012 WARN [DnsMonitor] DnsMonitor is disabled.
E
